page.title: 20A Day's Hunting:N.Silton
page.content: There is a national movement which is attempting to ban all blood sports. However the meeting of the Bilsdale Fox Hunt here is an important part of village life.The hunt meets at the "Gold Cup",Nether Silton where the landlord acts as host providing the "stirrup cup"(usually whisky)for the Master of the hunt and his attendants. Many villagers turn out to support the event. The huntsmen dressed in "hunting pink" make a striking picture mounted on horse back surrounded by the fell type hounds.They meet at 11 a.m. and "move off" to the sound of the hunting horn joined by many local riders.The hunt covers difficult country & the hounds are expected to work independently because of this.They are coloured with more white than usual in order that they may be seen on dark moorland.
